item.title: Wheelchair user left on plane by Gatwick Airport
item.description:
Sonia Sodha, a columnist for The Observer, writes on Twitter about the experience of her friend Victoria at Gatwick Airport.

Source: Twitter
Archive: archive.ph

UPDATE
Gatwick Airport, and their assistance provider Wilson James have apologised to the passenger for a service falling “far below our values and aims.”

Source: BBC News
Archive: archive.ph

item.title: Wheelchair user left on plane calls for review
item.description:
A wheelchair user who was stuck on a plane for two hours because there was no-one to help him disembark has called for support services to be properly funded and not be “an afterthought”.

Source: BBC News
Archive: archive.ph

item.title: Guide dog and owner turned away from Oxford restaurant
item.description:
A blind student was left feeling “shaken and excluded” after a restaurant said it would not allow them and their guide dog to eat inside.

Source: BBC News
Archive: archive.ph

item.title: Natasha Abrahart suicide: University discriminated against student
item.description:
A university has been told to pay more than Â£50,000 in damages for discriminating against a student who killed herself in 2018.

Source: BBC News

item.title: Frank Gardner: 'It happened again' - Why are wheelchair-users left on planes?
item.description:
Ben Furner experienced the same thing just weeks earlier at a different British airport. He was left on a plane while someone went in search of his mobility scooter.

Source: BBC News

item.title: Tesco refuse access to disabled man with guide dog, twice in a week
item.description:
In the United Kingdom, Sean Dilly, a correspondent for the BBC, details his experiences with access to Tesco with his guide dog.

Source: BBC News

item.title: Heathrow Airport leave disabled passenger on aircraft without assistance
item.description:
In the United Kingdom, Frank Gardner, a security correspondent for the BBC was left on an aircraft without assistance.

Source: Twitter

item.title: Newcastle Wetherspoons refuses assistance dog entry to pub
item.description:
In the United Kingdom, a 19 year old teenager was refused entry to a Wetherspoons pub.
